org.cougaar.planning.ldm.plan
Interface Constraint

All Known Subinterfaces:
NewConstraint
All Known Implementing Classes:
ConstraintImpl
public interface Constraint

Constraint Interface A Constraint is part of a Workflow. Constraints provide pair-wise precedence relationship information about the Tasks contained in the Workflow. A Task can have more than one applicable Constraint.

Method Detail

getConstrainingTask

Task getConstrainingTask()
 Task mytask = myconstraint.getConstrainingTask();

Returns:
Task Returns the Task which is constraining another event or Task.

getConstrainedTask

Task getConstrainedTask()
 Task mytask = myconstraint.getConstrainedTask();

Returns:
Task Returns a Task which is constrained by another event or Task.

getConstraintOrder

int getConstraintOrder()
Returns an int which represents the order of the Constraint. 
 int myorder = myconstraint.getConstraintOrder();

Returns:
int The int value will be equal to "0" (COINCIDENT), "-1" (BEFORE) or "1" (AFTER). There are also order analogues for constraints on non-temporal aspects. These are "1" (GREATERTHAN), "-1" (LESSTHAN) or "0" (EQUALTO).

getConstrainingAspect

int getConstrainingAspect()
Returns the aspect type of the constraint for the constraining task For non temporal constraints, constraining aspect and constrained aspect will be the same. For temporal constraints, they can be different. Eg (START_TIME and END_TIME)

getConstrainedAspect

int getConstrainedAspect()
Returns the aspect type of the constraint for the constrained task For non temporal constraints, constraining aspect and constrained aspect will be the same. For temporal constraints, they can be different. Eg (START_TIME and END_TIME)

getConstrainingEventObject

ConstraintEvent getConstrainingEventObject()
Return the ConstraintEvent object for the constraining task

getConstrainedEventObject

ConstraintEvent getConstrainedEventObject()
Return the ConstraintEvent object for the constrained task

getOffsetOfConstraint

double getOffsetOfConstraint()
Returns a double which represents the offset of the Constraint.

Returns:
the value to be added to the constraining value before comparing to the constrained value.

computeValidConstrainedValue

double computeValidConstrainedValue()
